oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1940 Sigma Club
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Middle Tennessee State Teacher's College
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Posed photograph of the Sigma Club, a student organization of the Middle Tennessee State Teacher's College.

The photograph was part of the 1940 Midlander yearbook. The club is described as: "an honorary organization composed of serious-minded men interested in intellectual and cultural development and actuated by worthy aims. It was founded in 1925 by Mr. Neal Frazier, and now has a total membership of one hundred ninety-three." The club was the only extra-curricular activity listed for Mr. Buchanan with his senior photograph.

SIGMA CLUB OFFICERS HALL HARRIS-_______________..____________________________President JAMES BAXTER_____._____________.____________________Vice-President DAVID ALDERMAN_________________________________Secretary MR. NEAL FRAZIER______________________________Sponsor
The Sigma Club is an honorary organization composed of serious-minded men interested in intellectual and cultural development and actuated by worthy aims. It was founded in 1925 by Mr. Neal Frazier, and now has a total membership of one hundred ninety-three.
OTHER MEMBERS
DENVER BAXTER, LEON BIBB, JAMES BUCHANAN, CHARLES BROWN, MORTIMER COHEN, WILLIAM DEUBERRY, HUGH DELZELL, JULIAN GOBELET, B. B. GRACY, III ROBERT L. MCCARTNEY, ALDERSON MILLER, DABNEY PHILLIPS, ROBERT ABERNATHY, J. M. EDNEY,
Graduate Faculty Members
W. B. JUDD, ROY SIMPSON, WILLIAM SHACKLETT, EDWIN SPILMAN, RAY THOMAS, JESSE WALLER, T. B. WOODMORE
